poem:
**Mornings with John Oliver**

Awake, the paper whispers  
of Oliver, unlikely moral sage.  
I imagine him sipping  
caffeinated indignation,  
his British charm a scalpel,  
carving truth from chaos.  
Somewhere, a cryptic text buzzes—  
a note of gratitude,  
a small flame in our sprawling darkness.  
This morning, the world briefly balanced.
